title: Magnitude-Phase Dual-Path Speech Enhancement Network based on Self-Supervised Embedding and Perceptual Contrast Stretch Boosting
author: Alimjan Mattursun (Xinjiang University), Liejun Wang (Xinjiang University), Yinfeng Yu (Xinjiang University), Chunyang Ma (Cadre Division Organization Department of the Party Committee, Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region), ...
relevance_why: This paper introduces a novel speech enhancement method using self-supervised learning that could be beneficial for Haohe Liu's research in audio quality enhancement and restoration tasks.
background: The task involves improving the clarity and intelligibility of speech signals and enhancing their quality in the presence of background noise and reverberation.
contribution: This paper introduces BSP-MPNet to solve speech enhancement problems by effectively combining self-supervised features with magnitude-phase information, achieving superior performance in various noise conditions.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often focused only on magnitude spectrum enhancement, which neglects the significant role of the phase spectrum, leading to degraded speech quality.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work addresses this gap by integrating phase spectrum processing through a dual-path framework and self-supervised learning.

key_innovation: Utilizes a combination of perceptual contrast stretching and self-supervised learning embeddings to enhance both magnitude and phase spectra of speech signals.
real_world_impact: Provides new insights into effective speech enhancement techniques, potentially improving applications in hearing aids, conference systems, and automatic speech recognition in challenging auditory environments.
limitations: The authors do not mention any specific limitations in this research.

new_terms.Perceptual Contrast Stretching: **Perceptual Contrast Stretching** is a spectral processing method that enhances the clarity of sound by amplifying the contrast within the spectrum based on human auditory sensitivity.
new_terms.self-supervised learning: **Self-supervised learning** refers to a machine learning approach where the model learns from unlabeled data by generating supervisory signals from the data itself.
